articles.content:
Preparatory committees for celebrating Sun's Day inaugurated abroad
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- A joint preparatory committee for celebrating Sun's Day was inaugurated on Mar. 14 under the cosponsorship of the struggle for the peace and socialism, the paper " Contropiano", the Citta Aperta radio and the "House of Peace" of Italy.
   A Mauritian preparatory committee with the chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Mauritius as its chairman was formed on the same day.
   A Maltese preparatory committee for celebrating Sun's Day was formed on Mar. 17 with the General Secretary of the C. C., the Communist Party of Malta as its chairman.
   The inaugural meetings pointed out that approaching April 15 is Sun's Day, 86th birthday of President Kim Il Sung, and an auspicious holiday for the Korean people as well as the progressive humankind and organisations all over the world.

articles.title: 10,000 S. Korean people go jobless every day
articles.content:
Int'l support for peaceful reunification of Korea
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Party and state leaders of different countries expressed support for the Korean people's struggle for national reunification, when they met with the Korean ambassadors to their countries.
   Cassam Uteem, President of Mauritius, supported the Korean people's efforts to achieve national reunification on the principle of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity put forward by President Kim Il Sung. He stressed that he would make every possible effort for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea in the future, too.
   He hoped that under the wise guidance of General Kim Jong Il, the Korean people would achieve prosperity of the country and national reunification at an early date.
   Navin Ramgoolam, Prime Minister of Mauritius, wished the Korean people great success in their struggle for prosperity and peaceful reunification of the country under the leadership of General Kim Jong Il.
   H. S. Surjeet, General Secretary of the C. C., the Communist Party of India (Marxist), expressed the conviction that with General Kim Jong Il as supreme leader of the party and state, the Korean people would surely win victory in the struggle for the building of socialism and reunification of the country.
   Iqbal Ahmed Khan, Secretary General of the Pakistan Muslim League, said he believes that Korea will be reunified in accordance with the proposals put forward by  President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Minju Joson marks Day of Pakistan
articles.content:
10,000 S. Korean people go jobless every day
 Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- 10,000 people are losing their jobs in South Korea every day, a radio report from Seoul said.
   "Subway stations are crowded with jobless people," radio No.1 of South Korea said, lamenting over sufferings imposed by IMF.

articles.title: Design for world domination
articles.content:
Minju Joson marks Day of Pakistan
Pyongyang, March 22 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson today marks Day Of Pakistan, the holiday of the Pakistani people.
   The Pakistani people have made many achievements in their efforts for consolidating the independence of the country, promoting the national unity and building a new prosperous society, a signed article of the daily says, and continues:
   The Pakistani government, pursuing the non-aligned foreign policy, has developed the ties of friendship and cooperation with different countries.
   The Korean people rejoice over the successes made by the Pakistani people in their efforts for the building of a new independent and prosperous society.
   They wished the Pakistani people new success in the efforts for the independent development and prosperity of their country, believing that the traditional Korea-Pakistan friendship forged on the road of anti-imperialism and independence would further develop.
